meanings.definition: To seize or take possession of property as a result of legal authority.
meanings.sent1: The government had to sequestrate the illegal goods found in the warehouse.
meanings.sent2: The court ordered to sequestrate the assets of the company involved in the fraud.
meanings.sent3: The detective decided to sequestrate the evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent4: The teacher had to sequestrate the students' phones during the exam.
meanings.sent5: The security guard had to sequestrate the unauthorized person from entering the building.

meanings.definition: To isolate or remove something from use or circulation.
meanings.sent1: The doctor had to sequestrate the contaminated food to prevent further illness.
meanings.sent2: The librarian had to sequestrate the damaged books from the collection.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to sequestrate the burnt cookies before serving them.
meanings.sent4: The IT department had to sequestrate the infected computer from the network.
meanings.sent5: The park ranger had to sequestrate the injured animal for treatment.
